intro: Belliopsis cordifolia, commonly known as the heartleaf bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It features heart-shaped leaves that are typically bright green and covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue or purple, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Belliopsis cordifolia is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and other moist habitats.
